posts.post_content: It's not about *winning*, it's about **power**.
posts.html:

Posted By: Majinkajisan (7/10/2013 9:55:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Possible repeated removal, card advantage, deck thinning (so you hopefully draw less lands), discard fodder, reliable land drops with less land in the deck, and a nice way to get out giant Demons in casual, or huge [Drain Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drain Life)s. Consider [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth) and [Grim Affliction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Affliction) to T5 her ultimate, you can do this at instant speed, leaving 2 lands untapped as well as your swamp from last turn untapped; giving you 12 mana to drop on whatever you feel. T5 with 12 {B} is a powerful thing in the right deck. To make it reliable have your backup plan be [Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) for 10 {B}.  
  
This is planeswalker is so Timmy it's awesome.  
  
Even if she's usually a slow [Tithe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tithe), she can be pretty useful just for making your deck reliable in the late turns of the game.

posts.post_content:
So I figured out the flavor behind tutoring Swamps. Your hand in basically your mind, it's what you're thinking about, right? And she fills your mind with Swamps, a.k.a. dirty, filthy things that cause you to do ruthless things and kill people?  
  
Next step: google search Liliana rule 34, then tell me your mind isn't filled with all sorts of nasty, filthy thoughts XD
